Class PowerUpController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameObjects.PowerUpController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAlarm

    public class PowerUpController
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAlarm
    Returns game to normal state after the timer for the power ups runs out.

    Tim Wöstemeier

    • Method Detail

      • alarmsActiveForThisObject

        public boolean alarmsActiveForThisObject()
        Description copied from interface: IAlarm
        Return false before the IAlarm object is destroyed for correct garbage collection of the alarms. When the IAlarm object is destroyed, the alarms will still exists. This causes a problem because the alarms prevent the garbage collector to clear up the IAlarm. When you want to delete a IAlarm, let this method return 'false' before you delete the IAlarm. NOTE: GameObjects will handle this by itself! If you really want your own implementation, override this method.
        Specified by:
        alarmsActiveForThisObject in interface IAlarm
        Returns:
        False if the alarms can be deleted.

      • triggerAlarm

        public void triggerAlarm(int alarmID)
        Description copied from interface: IAlarm
        This method will be triggered when the alarm goes off.
        Specified by:
        triggerAlarm in interface IAlarm
        Parameters:
        alarmID - The given ID of the alarm
